intro: Echeandia scabrella, commonly known as the roughleaf echeandia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Echeandia scabrella is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions with its thick, scaly leaves. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family in the Andean region.
